dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A listener writes in, "I keep hearing about Kazakhstan's new supercomputer and their own language model, KazLLM. Why is this such a big deal for the country?"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A listener writes in, I keep hearing about Kazakhstan's new supercomputer and their own language model, KazLLM. Why is this such a big deal for the country?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Why does the country need one of the most powerful supercomputers in the region and its own language model, KazLLM?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's a great question. It really gets to the heart of this idea of digital sovereignty, which they discussed on that Taldau Talks episode.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's a great question. It really gets to the heart of this idea of digital sovereignty, which they discussed on that Taldau Talks episode.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What is digital sovereignty, and when will digital inequality disappear in the country? These and other questions were discussed in the new episode of the Taldau Talks podcast, dedicated to digitalization and the development of artificial intelligence in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and Senate Speaker Maulen Ashimbayev was really emphasizing that point—it's not just about the tech itself, but a complete transformation of society.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and Senate Speaker Maulen Ashimbayev was really emphasizing that point-it's not just about the tech itself, but a complete transformation of society.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As noted by the Senate Speaker, digitalization is not just about implementing technologies, but a systemic transformation of all areas of life.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He mentioned President Tokayev's goal to make Kazakhstan into a digital hub for Eurasia, which is uh, pretty ambitious.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He mentioned President Tokayev's goal to make Kazakhstan into a digital hub for Eurasia, which is uh, pretty ambitious.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Kassym-Jomart Kemelevich Tokayev has set a clear goal " to turn Kazakhstan into a digital hub of Eurasia, where artificial intelligence is widely used and digital technologies are advancing. It is an ambitious but quite achievable goal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It is, but they're building the pieces for it—like that new International Center for Artificial Intelligence, Alem.AI.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is, but they're building the pieces for it-like that new International Center for Artificial Intelligence, the website.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The episode also discussed the launch of the International Center for Artificial Intelligence Alem.AI, the development of a network of data centers in the country, the training of IT specialists, and the implementation of modern AI technologies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the data centers, and training more IT specialists. They had Minister Zhaslan Madiyev on the podcast talking about that too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the data centers, and training more I T specialists. They had Minister Zhaslan Madiyev on the podcast talking about that too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Among the invited guests were Minister of Digital Development Zhaslan Madiyev, founder and CEO of the international passenger transport service Arsen Tomsky, and Chairperson of the Board of Kazakhstan's national postal operator Asel Zhanasova. The episode also discussed the launch of the International Center for Artificial Intelligence Alem.AI, the development of a network of data centers in the country, the training of IT specialists, and the implementation of modern AI technologies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So digital sovereignty means controlling your own tech infrastructure, your own AI, like KazLLM, instead of relying on other countries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So digital sovereignty means controlling your own tech infrastructure, your own A I, like KazLLM, instead of relying on other countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and hopefully that helps reduce digital inequality over time. It's a long process though.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and hopefully that helps reduce digital inequality over time. It's a long process though.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What is digital sovereignty, and when will digital inequality disappear in the country? These and other questions were discussed in the new episode of the Taldau Talks podcast, dedicated to digitalization and the development of artificial intelligence in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's not just about having flashy gadgets; it's about making sure everyone can benefit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's not just about having flashy gadgets; it's about making sure everyone can benefit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Building a full digital ecosystem, like Ashimbayev said—personnel, infrastructure, AI solutions. All of it has to come together.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Building a full digital ecosystem, like Ashimbayev said-personnel, infrastructure, A I solutions. All of it has to come together.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To accomplish it, we must build a full-fledged digital ecosystem based on professional personnel, modern infrastructure, and effective AI solutions.
